page.title: 16DALRY(KIRK) SOCIAL CUSTOMS
page.content: The annual ploughing match, clay pigeon shoot, poultry show and sheep dog trials, attract competitors both locally and from far afield. The agricultural show, held outside the village, has classes for sheep,cattle, donkeys,horses dogs and goats as well as showing agricultural machinery The Glenkens Society,formed in 1831 to encourage good workmanship and industrious habits, now organises an annual show of flowers, vegetables, cookery and crafts. The Clachan Fair,originally a hiring fair,then a sports day until 1939,was revived in 1977 and is now held every second summer. Money raised is mainly for the upkeep of the village hall. A fancy dress parade is led by pipeband; stalls in the decorated Main Street sell all manner of goods and sports are staged on the school playingfield.
